com.bluegosling.concurrent.locks

Class HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.concurrent.locks.HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock
    Enclosing class:
    HierarchicalLock

    public class HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock
extends Object
implements HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock
    The result of acquiring an exclusive lock on a HierarchicalLock. This object is used to release the lock or to change it (via promotion or demotion).
    See Also:
    HierarchicalLock.exclusiveLock(), HierarchicalLock.exclusiveLockInterruptibly(), HierarchicalLock.tryExclusiveLock(), HierarchicalLock.tryExclusiveLock(long, TimeUnit)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock demoteToChild(HierarchicalLock child)
      Demotes this lock to an exclusive lock on one of its children.
      HierarchicalLock.SharedLock demoteToShared()
      Demotes this exclusive lock into a shared lock.
      HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock promoteToParent()
      Promotes this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent.
      HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock promoteToParentInterruptibly()
      Promotes this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent, waiting interruptibly until it becomes available.
      HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock tryPromoteToParent()
      Tries to promote this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent, returning immediately if the parent lock is unavailable.
      HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock tryPromoteToParent(long timeLimit, TimeUnit unit)
      Tries to promote this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent, waiting up to the specified amount of time before giving up.
      void unlock()
      Releases the held lock.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Description copied from interface: HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock
        Releases the held lock.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock

      • demoteToShared

        public HierarchicalLock.SharedLock demoteToShared()
        Demotes this exclusive lock into a shared lock. This basically releases the held lock and replaces it with a shared lock on the same HierarchicalLock. Due to already holding the exclusive lock, demotion will not need to block.
        Returns:
        the newly acquired shared lock
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this thread does not hold this lock or has already released it; or if the exclusive lock has been acquired more than once (in a re-entrant manner)

      • demoteToChild

        public HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock demoteToChild(HierarchicalLock child)
        Demotes this lock to an exclusive lock on one of its children. On success, this held lock is released and replaced with a new HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock that represents the lock on the child. Due to exclusively holding this lock (preventing other child locks from being held), demotion will not block.
        Specified by:
        demoteToChild in interface HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock
        Parameters:
        child - the child of this lock to which this lock is demoted
        Returns:
        the newly acquired lock on the given child
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this thread does not hold this lock or has already released it; if the given lock is not actually a child of the HierarchicalLock which produced this HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock; or if this thread holds more than one such exclusive lock (from re-entrance)
        DeadlockException - if waiting for the child lock would result in a deadlock (e.g. this thread holds a lock for which another thread is waiting, and that thread, or some other thread that directly or indirectly is waiting on it, is holding the child lock)

      • promoteToParent

        public HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock promoteToParent()
        Promotes this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent. On success, the held lock is released and replaced with a new HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock that represents the lock on the parent. This method will block until the parent lock becomes available.
        Specified by:
        promoteToParent in interface HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock
        Returns:
        the newly acquired lock on the parent
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this thread does not hold this lock or has already released it; if the lock that produced this HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock is a root lock and does not have a parent; or if the implicit parent lock cannot be promoted to exclusive because this thread already holds the parent lock more than once (from re-entrance)
        DeadlockException - if waiting for the parent lock would result in a deadlock (e.g. this thread holds a lock for which another thread is waiting, and that thread, or some other thread that directly or indirectly is waiting on it, is holding the parent lock)

      • promoteToParentInterruptibly

        public HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock promoteToParentInterruptibly()
                                                            throws InterruptedException
        Promotes this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent, waiting interruptibly until it becomes available. On success, the held lock is released and replaced with a new HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock that represents the lock on the parent.
        Returns:
        the newly acquired lock on the parent
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting for the parent lock to become available
        IllegalStateException - if this thread does not hold this lock or has already released it; if the lock that produced this HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock is a root lock and does not have a parent; or if the implicit parent lock cannot be promoted to exclusive because this thread already holds the parent lock more than once (from re-entrance)
        DeadlockException - if waiting for the parent lock would result in a deadlock (e.g. this thread holds a lock for which another thread is waiting, and that thread, or some other thread that directly or indirectly is waiting on it, is holding the parent lock)

      • tryPromoteToParent

        public HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock tryPromoteToParent()
        Tries to promote this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent, returning immediately if the parent lock is unavailable. On success, the held lock is released and replaced with a new HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock that represents the lock on the parent.
        Returns:
        the newly acquired lock on the parent or null if the parent lock is not available
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this thread does not hold this lock or has already released it; if the lock that produced this HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock is a root lock and does not have a parent; or if the implicit parent lock cannot be promoted to exclusive because this thread already holds the parent lock more than once (from re-entrance)
        DeadlockException - if waiting for the parent lock would result in a deadlock (e.g. this thread holds a lock for which another thread is waiting, and that thread, or some other thread that directly or indirectly is waiting on it, is holding the parent lock)

      • tryPromoteToParent

        public HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock tryPromoteToParent(long timeLimit,
                                                         TimeUnit unit)
                                                  throws InterruptedException
        Tries to promote this lock to an exclusive lock on its parent, waiting up to the specified amount of time before giving up. On success, the held lock is released and replaced with a new HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock that represents the lock on the parent.
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - the limit of time to wait for the lock
        unit - the unit of the time limit
        Returns:
        the newly acquired lock on the parent or null if the time limit lapsed and the parent lock never became available
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted while waiting for the parent lock to become available
        IllegalStateException - if this thread does not hold this lock or has already released it; if the lock that produced this HierarchicalLock.ExclusiveLock is a root lock and does not have a parent; or if the implicit parent lock cannot be promoted to exclusive because this thread already holds the parent lock more than once (from re-entrance)
        DeadlockException - if waiting for the parent lock would result in a deadlock (e.g. this thread holds a lock for which another thread is waiting, and that thread, or some other thread that directly or indirectly is waiting on it, is holding the parent lock)
